column4: ok i've read alot but still have no idea why i can't get this smartlink 1800 pci modem to read
could i set up a direct connection to my windows nic and use the dial up from it to try to post the problem to ubuntu servers for help?
or am i just wasting my time trying to get online with it until broadband is an option in my area in 2009?
dial-up is my only option
100 US dollars a month for the cheepest one i can find, that's just too far out of my price range
so the bottem line is that i'm pretty well "s.o.l." if all i can use is dial-up
read that, didn't help me any, didn't even offer my modem chipset anywhere with all that

and i have like 3 conexant modems but i'm trying to use linux to get away from paying for software, drivers, ect.  ; the only place to get drivers for those modems wants to charge you for them, and i can't see doing that with something that's open sorce
have you downloaded and run the 'scanModem' script ?
hmm, ok, that's not good
if scanModem crashes, I'd recommend mailing the linmodem mailing list
i'll try scanmodem again and see what happens, maybe i messed it up somewhere
hmm. maybe
unfortunately, these win modems are a major pain.  I have one myself
it makes every kernel upgrade and adventure!
yes, it does.  I have an intel 536ep
it should be
offhand, I can't remember which one
although it's very thorough, i do find scanModem's output to be a little verbose
any help is better then none
thanks for all the help so far, i'll be back if i need more
